metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19815 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel 5.0.21, mounting a crafted f2fs filesystem image can cause a NULL pointer dereference in f2fs_recover_fsync_data in fs/f2fs/recovery.c. This is related to F2FS_P_SB in fs/f2fs/f2fs.h.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19815` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.3.0-1016-aws - 5.3.0-1016.17~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1018-aws - 5.4.0-1018.18~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-1007-azure - 5.3.0-1007.8~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1020-azure - 5.4.0-1020.20~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
